PermissionSetTabSetting.name: PermissionSetTabSetting
PermissionSetTabSetting.description: Represents a tab’s settings for a profile or permission set. Use PermissionSetTabSetting for manipulating tab visibility on profiles and permission sets.

Name.description: The tab’s API name. For standard tabs, the name is in the form “standard-Account”. For custom tabs, it’s the developer name.

ParentId.description: The ID of the permission set to which this tab setting belongs. For profile tab settings, ParentId is the ID of the permission set owned by the profile.

Visibility.description: The default visibility setting for this tab. Valid values are: Default Off Default On Note There’s no hidden value. Instead, a hidden tab is indicated by having no PermissionSetTabSetting row in the database.
